intro: Causonis timoriensis, commonly known as the Timor sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the island of Timor in Indonesia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in sandy or coastal soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid conditions. Its small white or pale yellow flowers are often clustered in umbrella-like structures, and it produces small, round fruits. Causonis timoriensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
